items.title: chore: enable strictPropertyInitialization check in TS.

labels.name: cla: yes
labels.description: PR author has agreed to Google's Contributor License Agreement

items.body:
This is generally a recommended check for all TS projects and part of
--strict checks. Properly fixing all instances is a hard task and there
are 200+ failures with this check.

Luckily, there is a suppression - putting ! on the property name, and I
had an auto-fixer handy, so this PR suppresses all old instances.

This will allow new code to be written to be conforming while the old
code will continue to work as expected.

Each suppression has a comment added to remind the owners to revisit the
decision to use ! (as it is unsafe). This separates the intentional
usage of !, from the auto-inserted ones.

see issue #13329

items.title: bug([mat-dialog]): screenreader navigation order not logical

labels.name: G
labels.description: This is is related to a Google internal issue

labels.name: needs clarification
labels.description: The issue does not contain enough information for the team to determine if it is a real bug

items.body:
*This is similar to this issue that I filed earlier https://github.com/angular/components/issues/19253

#### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
*must navigate with VO commands to reproduce, not keyboard tab

turn on mac voiceover (system preferences -> accessibility -> voiceover --> enable voiceover)
at url above use voiceover to navigate to the mat-dialog button

select the mat-dialog button
navigate to next element using voiceover (not tab)

*Voiceover command == VO == caps lock key or control + option by default
VO + shift + down arrow == enter the element to navigate children of element
VO + space == select the element
VO + left/right arrow == navigate to prev/next element

#### Expected Behavior

What behavior were you expecting to see?
-screen reader focus should be on the mat-dialog

#### Actual Behavior

What behavior did you actually see?
-the screen reader focus is on the entire page content, if you navigate forward one more item, then it is on the mat-dialog
-also you dismiss the mat-dialog by hitting a cancel button in the mat-dialog, the screen reader focus returns to the beginning of the page rather than going to back to the mat-dialog button that launched the dialog

#### Environment

- Angular: 9.10
- CDK/Material: 9.22
- Browser(s): chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS

items.title: build: ensure build uses typescript 3.9

labels.name: P2
labels.description: Important issue that should be resolved as soon as possible

labels.name: blocked
labels.description: This issue is blocked by some external factor, such as a prerequisite PR

labels.name: cla: yes
labels.description: PR author has agreed to Google's Contributor License Agreement

labels.name: target: major
labels.description: This PR is targeted for the next major release

items.body:
We recently updated TS 3.9 in the `package.json` with https://github.com/angular/components/pull/19286, but the build did
not pick up the new version. This is because peer dependency ranges
did not accept TS 3.9, so yarn hoisted sufficient TS versions.

items.title: MatDialog: When using in dynamically loaded component throws error No provider for MatDialog

labels.name: needs triage
labels.description: This issue needs to be triaged by the team

items.body:
#### Reproduction

When using MatDialog in a dynamically loaded component it doesn't work and throws error `No provider for MatDialog`.

Steps to reproduce:
1.  Follow the instructions in this post (https://medium.com/angular-in-depth/lazy-load-components-in-angular-596357ab05d8 ) to create a dynamically loaded component
2.  Add `MatDialogModule` to the imports array of `NGModule` for the dynamically loaded component.
3. `ng serve` and check the error in console.
 
#### Expected Behavior

It should work without throwing any error.

#### Actual Behavior

Throws below error:

```
zone-evergreen.js:659 Unhandled Promise rejection: R3InjectorError(AppBrowserModule)[MatDialog -> MatDialog -> MatDialog]: 
  NullInjectorError: No provider for MatDialog! ; Zone: <root> ; Task: Promise.then ; Value: NullInjectorError: R3InjectorError(AppBrowserModule)[MatDialog -> MatDialog -> MatDialog]: 
  NullInjectorError: No provider for MatDialog!
    at NullInjector.get (http://localhost:4200/vendor.js:34269:27)
    at R3Injector.get (http://localhost:4200/vendor.js:48199:33)
    at R3Injector.get (http://localhost:4200/vendor.js:48199:33)
    at R3Injector.get (http://localhost:4200/vendor.js:48199:33)
    at NgModuleRef$1.get (http://localhost:4200/vendor.js:65751:33)
    at Object.get (http://localhost:4200/vendor.js:63486:35)
    at getOrCreateInjectable (http://localhost:4200/vendor.js:38115:39)
    at Module.ɵɵdirectiveInject (http://localhost:4200/vendor.js:52134:12)
    at NodeInjectorFactory.MyDynamicallyLoadedComponent_Factory [as factory] 
```


#### Environment

- Angular: 10.0.0-next.6 (same behavior in other versions e.g. 9.x)
- CDK/Material: 9.2.3
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows

items.title: fr(cdk/drag-drop): support configurable propagation of mousedown and touchstart events

labels.name: feature
labels.description: This issue represents a new feature or feature request rather than a bug or bug fix

labels.name: needs triage
labels.description: This issue needs to be triaged by the team

items.body:
#### Feature Description

Allow exposing native mousedown and touchstart events to parent elements such  that listeners farther up the chain can respond before a CdkDragEvent has started. Without these events, certain gestures (swiper, etc) cannot be achieved when events are started on a DragRef element, as drag-drop effectively swallows them whether they are used or not.

This feature should be enabled only if desired using the `CDK_DRAG_CONFIG` InjectionToken / provider pattern.

#### Use Case

Allow propagation of events to parent components in the DOM. Example: Using a cdkDragDrop component inside a horizontal swiper, where the native element's scroll direction is vertical.

items.title: fix(autocomplete): incorrectly detecting shadow DOM when inserted through an embedded view

labels.name: P3
labels.description: Important issue that needs to be resolved

labels.name: cla: yes
labels.description: PR author has agreed to Google's Contributor License Agreement

labels.name: lgtm
labels.description: "Looks good to me", this PR is approved by team member

labels.name: merge ready
labels.description: This PR is ready to run through Google's internal presubmit

labels.name: target: patch
labels.description: This PR is targeted for the next patch release

items.body:
When an autocomplete is inserted, we try to figure out whether it's in the shadow DOM so that we can handle outside clicks properly. It seems like our logic can run too early in some cases, causing it to be detected incorrectly. These changes move the logic later in the process, right before the overlay is attached to the DOM.

Fixes #19330.

**Note:** In the first iteration I had a unit test for this, but I couldn't get it to pass on ViewEngine, because one of the APIs I used to query for an element in the shadow DOM wasn't working. Since we don't have a way of disabling tests for ViewEngine, I ended up reverting it.

items.body:
#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: https://stackblitz.com/fork/components-issue

https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-nkebqj?file=src%2Fapp%2Fexample-component.ts

Steps to reproduce:
1. Hit submit with a blank datepicker
 
I can't reproduce in the Stackblitz.
 
#### Expected Behavior

What behavior were you expecting to see?
The MatDatepicker should allow for an empty field.

#### Actual Behavior

What behavior did you actually see?
The MatDatepicker adds an error to the FormControl's errors array, with MatDatepickerParse. The error text is `""`. 

From the form:
```
date: FormControl
  asyncValidator: null
  errors:

  __proto__: Object

  pristine: true
  status: "INVALID"
```

items.title: bug(mat-autocomplete): Using ngFor in matTab in combination with Shadowdom breaks mat-autocomplete

labels.name: P3
labels.description: Important issue that needs to be resolved

labels.name: has pr
labels.description: A PR has been created to address this issue

items.body:
#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-y21fh9

Steps to reproduce:

1.  Set encapsulation to ViewEncapsulation.ShadowDom of a component, in this case the root component, app.component.
2.  Create a mat-tab-group in the html of the component.
3. Create property which contains the tabs, use a json like structure with several tabs, each tab containing a name and its options.
3.  Use ngFor to create several mat-tabs, use the tab name dynamically to set the label of the tab.
4.  Create an autocomplete component use the tab.options to set the options of the mat-autocomplete. 
5.  Click on the autocomplete inside 1 of the tabs
 
#### Expected Behavior

What behavior were you expecting to see?
Mat autocomplete, opens its options dropdown.

#### Actual Behavior

What behavior did you actually see?
Mat autocomplete is closed immediately on click


#### Environment

- Angular: 9.1.4
- CDK/Material: 9.2.2 / 9.2.3
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows

labels.name: P3
labels.description: Important issue that needs to be resolved

labels.name: has pr
labels.description: A PR has been created to address this issue

items.body:
#### Reproduction

Issue can be reproduced on: https://material.angular.io/components/progress-bar/examples

Steps to reproduce:
1. Click on buffer mode
2. Observe the wrong behavior of buffering at the beginning of the progress bar

#### Expected Behavior

Buffering part of the progress bar should be visible just on the right side of the progress bar

#### Actual Behavior

It seems that there is some rendering problem when buffer mode is on. Dots are visible even through the right part of the progress bar (the purple part)

items.title: bug([mat-table]): [Nested ng-container inside mat-table stopped working]

labels.name: needs triage
labels.description: This issue needs to be triaged by the team

items.body:
#### Reproduction

When updating @ angular / material to version 9, the template with the embedded <ng-container * ngIf = "column! == 'select'"> stops working. Throws an error: "Duplicate column definition name provided:" select "". In version 8 it works.

Steps to reproduce:
When updating @ angular / material to version 9, the template stops working. In version 8 it works.

Example for version 9: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ky8jxx-select-table-yd9qsd?file=src%2Fapp%2Fapp.component.html

Example for version 8: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ky8jxx-select-table-dvzqbi?file=src%2Fapp%2Fapp.component.html

If you remove the wrapper with <ng-container * ngIf = "column! == 'select'">, then it starts working in version 9, but this is not the kind of behavior that is required, since there are different templates for different columns.
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

The template works in version 9.


#### Actual Behavior

Template stopped working in version 9


#### Environment

- Angular: ^9.0.0
- CDK/Material: ^9.0.0
- Browser(s): Google Chrome 81
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows

items.title: fix: unable to set expanded or collapsed height in expansion panel

labels.name: cla: yes
labels.description: PR author has agreed to Google's Contributor License Agreement

labels.name: lgtm
labels.description: "Looks good to me", this PR is approved by team member

labels.name: merge ready
labels.description: This PR is ready to run through Google's internal presubmit

labels.name: merge safe
labels.description: This PR does not affect library code used inside Google and can be merged without a Google presubmit

labels.name: target: development-branch
labels.description: This pr is targeted for a non-release branch

items.body:
For the density system, we reworked the expansion panel to no longer
rely on Angular animations. Looks like the refactoring missed that units
are already set for the `expandedHeight` and `collapsedHeight` inputs.

This hasn't been catched in any unit test, so tests are updated to catch this now.

items.title: fix(table): incorrectly sticking multiple footer rows

labels.name: P3
labels.description: Important issue that needs to be resolved

labels.name: cla: yes
labels.description: PR author has agreed to Google's Contributor License Agreement

labels.name: lgtm
labels.description: "Looks good to me", this PR is approved by team member

labels.name: merge ready
labels.description: This PR is ready to run through Google's internal presubmit

labels.name: target: patch
labels.description: This PR is targeted for the next patch release

items.body:
The loop that sticks headers and footers is run in reverse for footers. The problem is that we were only reversing the order of the elements, but not the sticky states which resulted in them being flipped. E.g. setting the last row to be sticky would actually stick the first one.

Fixes #19311.

items.title: feat(benchmarks): setup for benchmarking components

labels.name: cla: yes
labels.description: PR author has agreed to Google's Contributor License Agreement

items.body:
### Summary

* Set up components repo to use dev-infra benchmarking tools
* Create first set of benchmark tests for mat-checkbox

### Current Workaround

This change depends on two changes to angular/angular.

1. PR [#36800](https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/36800)
2. The resolution of Issue [#36986](https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/36986)

Until those changes have been made, the current workaround is to

1. Checkout the working branch for PR [#36800](https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/36800)
2. Fix Issue [#36986](https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/36986)
3. Run `yarn bazel build //dev-infra:npm_package.pack` to create a local version of dev-infra

This workaround allows us to change the package.json in angular/components to depend on the files from this locally published version of dev-infra.

items.title: feat(focus indicators): Add a more powerful customization mixin.

labels.name: cla: yes
labels.description: PR author has agreed to Google's Contributor License Agreement

items.body:
Replaced `mat-strong-focus-indicators-theme` with `mat-strong-focus-indicator-customize`. The former only allowed for customizing the focus indicator's color, the latter allows for customizing color, thickness, shape, inset/offset, etc.

Duplicated the mixin changes to the MDC equivalent.

After this PR, we should be comfortable publishing official documentation to Angular Material on using strong focus indicators.

items.title: bug([MatFormFieldHarness]): getControl() returns first input on the page, not the input within the form field

labels.name: needs triage
labels.description: This issue needs to be triaged by the team

items.body:
#### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a form with two mat form fields, each with a respective mat input
2. Get the harness for the 2nd form field's mat input (via the 2nd form field harness' `getControl()` method), and set it to any value.
 
#### Expected Behavior

Setting the value of the mat input returned by `getControl()` should set the value of the mat input associated with the corresponding form field.

#### Actual Behavior

Setting the value of the mat input returned by `getControl()` sets the value of the first mat input on the page, not necessarily the one associated with the form field. 

#### Environment

- Angular: 9.1.1
- CDK/Material: 9.1.3
- Browser(s): Jest 25.5.4
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS

items.title: prebuilt theme "pink-blue-grey" color set is partially different from which is mentioned on angular material official site

labels.name: needs triage

items.body:
#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: https://stackblitz.com/fork/components-issue

Steps to reproduce:
1. just install the latest version ng mat and choose pink blue grey theme.
2. inspect element to check the difference.
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

What behavior were you expecting to see?

color set which is downloaded via ng add stuff should be the same as which is mentioned on official site 

#### Actual Behavior

What behavior did you actually see?
Downloaded version primary color: #c2185b
Official site version primary color: #e91e63
Downloaded version accent color: #b0bec5
Official site version accent color: #607d8b



#### Environment

- Angular:
- CDK/Material:
- Browser(s):
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu):
